title: Capstone project - Seneca College
explanation: As part of a agile team, created a web application using NodeJS, grafana and influxDB to read information from modBus solar panel inverters. the goal of the project was to read information from PLC placed inside Seneca Newnham Campus, the data was read using NodeJS and sent to influxDB, afterwards the data would be downloaded to grafana where we calculated expected output using a formula produced by Seneca's Engineering team which took into consideration weather, plant layout, inverter age and more. Also the software was able to predict inverter failure and reduce downtime. Our app was Sponsered by a third party company(Voltare Power).

title: Peer Tutor - Seneca College
explanation: as a paid certified tutor in colaborative environment, Tutored students in a one-on-one or group based calsses to improve their knowledge in React, Angular and html-css topics that were included with their WEB322 and WEB422

title: Health Passport - Hackaton
explanation: Responsible for the complete logic and security design of the health passport android App. designed to be used for proof of vaccination during the pandemic. project was awarded second place.

title: Personal Portfolio Website
explanation: designed a website using react, html5, css3, bootstrap. the project contained full git source control and development cycles

title: Chess console app - Personal Project
explanation: created a chess app using C++ and added it to github inorder to continue working on it in the future

title: Running App - IBM i project
explanation: Developed a long-range studio appliation for IOS that uses GPS and Google maps to calculate exact point to point distances on the built in map for runners and joggers.
